Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in a good place”
Reviews.Author: sibij
Reviews.Content: I spent here 3 nights on a business trip. When I reached the hotel (around midnight) there was no reservation for me, which sounded strange since I had in my hands a pre-paid voucher bought my my company on some website. Luckily there was a vacant room, so I slept there. More luckily, the room was in the executive floor, and the next morning the manager told me they had some problem with bookings, and since he was very sorry for the trouble I received an upgrade for the three nights, which I spent in the room I slept in the first night (no overcharge, obviously). They also sent me some fresh fruit in the room. My room, at the 6th floor, was very nice; spacious and well-furnished, with a very comfortable bed, a big toilet, big shower, plenty of hot water. Breakfast was really good, served at the 7th floor in a nice room overlooking the Bosphorus. The staff is kind and helpful. The location is really good, in the middle of a very lively area, full of restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing four night stay in Executive Suite”
Reviews.Author: AdiFiz
Reviews.Content: Richmond Hotel is the only hotel directly ON Istiklal Caddesi, the heart of modern Istanbul, a walk away from Taksim Square. The room looked directly onto the hustle and bustle of the street with shoppers and tourists. It was a great feeling to be right in the centre of such an interesting place. There are plenty of shops, eating places etc, and public transport is very accessible. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful at all times. The rooms are spacious, we were extremely pleased with the TV and channel selection as well as the excellent bathroom suite. The shower was truly luxurious, and rooms were cleaned to a high standard. The lounge was also lovely and had computer access. Whilst the breakfast was good it wasn't very interesting as every day was more or less the same and there was one awkard morning where they asked for our room number before we entered, which hadn't happened the previous morning. Apart from that service was always excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: rashafahmi
Reviews.Content: I stayed with 5 of my friends 8 days in July, 2011, I've been in Turkey the previous week & that's why I decided to write a review about Richmond hotel. Actually its location in Istiklal street is perfect, its beside a metro station, the service is good, the varieties in the breakfast buffet is very reasonable & the view in the restaurant is awesome. I am looking forward to go there next summer vacation

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ohjustpeachy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after researching a lot of hotels and deciding it would suit us best to be in the heart of the new town. Its location on Istikal Cadessi is perfect for nightlife with lots of bars & restaurants close by. The hotel's breakfast room has great views over Istanbul and offers a wide range of foods that should suit every diet. We asked for a smoking room at the back of the hotel & that's exactly what we got; it was relatively quiet and there was enough room for us both and our suitcases though not a lot of wardrobe space. The wifi worked fine for us and we had no problems connecting. We walked down and across galata bridge to the old town every day (about 30 mins to spice market) and trekked back uphill from Karakoy each evening for meals out and drinks. There are plenty of transport options and the tram at Karakoy (about 10 min walk downhill from hotel) will bring you to the archeological museum, topkapi palace, blue mosque, hagia sophia and the grand bazaar for 2TL per trip. Our air conditioning only worked to give hot air but thankfully the large window opened so we controlled the room temperature with fresh air. The room safe was useful and when we had a problem with it a staff member was with us immediately and resolved the issue. All staff of the hotel were helpful and friendly with plenty of English speakers when we needed assistance. Overall it was a positive experience and I'd recommend watching the sunset at the bar in Leb i Derya on the 6th floor at least once!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel, very well located”
Reviews.Author: marlo d
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay, we reserved via email through a receptionist named Eda. she made it clear to us we would have a room facing the garden and would make sure they would accomodate for us non-smokers even though the room was "smoking" When we arrived, they had upgraded us to a bigger room with garden view , non smoking room. Location is great because in the day, you walk down to galata bridge and cross it to Sultanamhet in 20 minutes, and at night, you don't need any transportation apart from your feet, as you are centrally located where the nightlife is at! Thanks for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “In one word - GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: AnaV1705
Reviews.Content: Great location - five minutes with taxi to historical area or 3 minutes walking to Metro station for Tunel from where you can go walking over Galata Bridge to Sultanahmet. Istiklal street is very safe street and it has tones of shops, good restaurants and bars for night life ( recco: 360 club and bar on top of the hotel with great view on Istanbul ). Hotel staff was very friendly, polite and help us with any request, we felt really great there. Our rooms were on the 5th floor in the back side and they were very quite. Breakfast was also great. My friends and I will for sure stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel on Istiklal”
Reviews.Author: Terri T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the last week of November 2011. We took the advice of others on this site and booked a room in the back of the hotel on the 4th floor to ensure quiet nights. The location is excellent if you want to be close to restaurants and nightlife. We are avid walkers and found the walk over to the old district not difficult. The staff is extremely helpful. Somehow our passcode for the in room safe wasn't working. The manager came in on his day off to open the safe for us. We learned with other interactions with the staff that most of the staff has worked for the hotel for at least 10 years. Given the usual turnover in hospitality this speaks volumes of how satisfied the staff are and it shows in how they treat their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and people”
Reviews.Author: Ado677
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a great location at the walking shopping Istiklal street ,not very far from Taxim square.Friendly and polite staff , expecially at the 6 th floor restaurant serving very tasty turkish breakfast with a view on Istanbul panorama.A little difficult is, no elevators from the hotel entrance level to lobby level and limited space for storing clothes in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: canil
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with a perfect location in istanbul. Breakfast with wiew over all istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Liers and no help in trouble”
Reviews.Author: Mikko107
Reviews.Content: They promised a safe parking for our car and we paid for it. However, the car was broken during the night. They said they'd help us to repair it, but they never did. Neither did they pay anything for the damage or had insurance to cover the cost. They sent us to the local police department, where nobdy speaks any other language expect Turkish! I'll never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: Phil S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel in November. We were welcomed upon arrival and the front desk was helpful in terms of reputable restaurants and attractions close-by, including the extensive shopping strip immediately out front. The hotel supplied WiFi and the rooms were clean, as were the showers and toilet. Our accommodation was located on the Executive floor and the foyer area was sparse and occupied both lounges and bar area. Hotel comes with good recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “We won't go to this hotel again,they cheat us”
Reviews.Author: a a
Reviews.Content: We have booked a tripple room but they give us a doubble bedroom with an extra bed which was very uncomfortable in a small room,in the last day when we told them our claim,the man in reception told us you should have told in the first day not now! when we told him :you should charge us with the price of doubble bedroom ,he told it is not possible so they really cheat us and this hotel compare to another 4star hotel (which is located near Taksim Square) is very expensive (we stayed there last summer ,it had pool and spa) but this richmond hotel has no extra facility such as pool ,spa,...

Reviews.Title: “best view”
Reviews.Author: carefreehills
Reviews.Content: This hotel on a pedestrian street in IStanbul is lovely, and at a great location. Close to many great restaurants and vibrant night life. Rooftop expensive restaurant, food just Ok, but the view and hip people watching is worth it. Can't wait to get back to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CRAZYHORSE694
Reviews.Content: The hotel has got a great location. You are walking distance from major sites. (if you like walking) Rooms are a bit small but very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, could be better”
Reviews.Author: cyrilo_durand
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the heart of Beyoglu, on the main street of the city with a beautiful view from the roof. Rooms are clean and comfortable. But: - No welcome attitude from the staff (the 4 men always waiting in the lobby never say hello, do not carry your luggage and do not apologize when mistakes are made on the bill) - Breakfast is poor - Rooms are noisy at night because of the outdoor life

Reviews.Title: “The unfriendliest place I have stayed - ever”
Reviews.Author: Milliesydney
Reviews.Content: I can't remember feeling so unwelcome in a hotel....there is a bar in the lobby where we tried on 3 occassions to get a drink. The first time I sat there for 30 minutes while the bartender ignored me I walked out and went elsewhere. The next evening I waited for 15 minutes and was again ignored and went elsewhere. On the third night my husband and I went into the bar for a nightcap after dinner, the bartender was talking to the person at the Reception desk after a few minutes I went over and asked if the the bar was open he said it was but continued to chat to his friend and no offer of service. We left and went elsewhere. The breakfast was horrible we were again ignored by the staff I smiled and said good morning to one of them and they just looked straight through me. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel after that even though it was included in the price - the tea was in a self service nescafe machine and was undrinkable The air conditioning was useless unless you stood right under the vent the room was so hot it disgraceful. I don't know how this place was awarded a 4 star rating but I do know we would never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Good value”
Reviews.Author: MainBeach1
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel a little hard to find but once we found it and got our bearings the hotel was the perfect fit to begin to explore Istanbul. The Richmond Hotel is situated on a Street that runs from Taxim square to the Tunel on the European side of the Bosphorus. It is a very busy shopping area with cinemas, bars, restaurants, cafes etc. It has great atmosphere and the buzz continues from dawn until late into the night. The location has you right in the middle of the action on that side of the city and a short stroll to the Bosphorus to explore the Asian side of the city. It certainly is not a big fancy hotel, probably more of a boutique size with clean and well-appointed rooms with not overly large bathrooms and we found it great value for money. Rooms on the street side of the hotel may pick up some noise from the street below however if this does not worry you it will add to the experience of this very historic city. Donâ€™t be afraid to use the buses and trams to move around the city they are great fun. Overall a great little hotel in the cosmopolitan hub of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and views but only go for the rooms at the back”
Reviews.Author: Neeltoosh
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights split into two by a trip to Anatolia. We had read about the noisy rooms so we paid extra to get the Executive Floor (5th and 6th). With this we had a great view of the Bosphorus (though the antennas of the Russian Embassy next door do spoil the camera shots) and no noise hassles. The breakfast at the top floor restaurant is good but lacks variety after a couple of days. Unlike our experience in other Turkish hotels they did provide bottles of water (though no refills) and the room had tea/coffee machine. Our main cribs was a lengthy check-in. We had to wait nearly 4 hours, which after a 11 hours red-eye flight was rather irritating. Secondly, the rooms itself were quite small especially for the price we paid. The photos on the website are a bit misleading. The issue with the airconditioning mentioned elsewhere in the forum seems a general problem. We put it on full blast yet the room would remain warm. Another guest complained and got upgraded to a suite for the last day. They seriously need to get this fixed. The internet was terrible the first 3 days. Looks like they had fixed it because when we came back after a week it was much better, though not super fast. I would still recommond the hotel for its location and view. Make sure you take a room in the back as it would be very noisy staying next to Istiklal Caddesi.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing, rude, unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: harriszena
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in this hotel and were very disappointed. We complained 4 times that the air conditioning was not working in the room and other than provide us with a noisy fan nothing else was resolved. Had to sleep with the window open and fan on and the room still uncomfortably hot so had 2 poor nights sleep. The staff were rude and unhelpful from the moment we arrived. They don't have maps so couldn't help give us directions to a dinner reservation we had (we ended up going into a hotel up the road who were far more helpful than our own), and couldn't provide us with even the most basic of tourist information. Shower in our room leaked so floor constantly wet. We did have a nice view from our room though.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: madmax44
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Ideally placed for access to the main tourist (and shopping) areas, provided you don't mind a little walking - and, for a complete stranger, going about Istanbul any other way is not easy unless you want to live in a taxi. The hotel staff were very friendly, cheerful and helpful - particularly when we asked to move our room to the quieter side of the hotel (away from the street) or when the attractive office secretary helped me print out my boarding pass. My only (minor!) disappointment was the coffee served in the morning! Pumped out of a Nescafe machine I can only suppose it really was instant coffee! A tourist map or two in the foyer would also have been helpful but most guide books do have these anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Newly refurbished and great location”
Reviews.Author: SurajShah
Reviews.Content: I didnt do enough research on Istanbul and went by the recommendation of a work colleague to spend a few extra days in Istanbul after my work conference. The Richmond is located in the very happening street of Istikal Cadesi. The rooms have been refurbished and are very good for the price. The reception staff is very friendly and helpful but the breakfast staff are dour faced1 The only snag is that if you do want a quiet night and your room faces Istikal Street then you are in for a disappointment! It is very noisy and there will be screams and shouts from revelers walking back home along the street. In the mornings, the cleaning and delivery trucks takeover so so there is no lie in either.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: pm309
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in early November and were with a small tour group. We were very pleased with the hotel. The rooms were very nice. Dinner and breakfast was included in our rate. Breakfast was a buffet and it was good with enough choices. Dinner was a sit down meal and was very good. The location is great for shopping. It has mostly pedestrian traffic. Our bus was not able to take us directly to the hotel, so we had to walk a short distance from where the bus could stop to the hotel. We would strongly recommend you request a room that is not right on the street. We were on the third floor, facing the street. The first night we were there was a Thursday and we had been travelling so the noise did not bother us much as we were exhausted. It was relatively quiet after 11 PM. The next night it was very noisy, until well past 3 AM. Our guide said Saturday would be worse, but fortunately we were not there on a Saturday.

Reviews.Title: “Good only if you don't stay in the rooms with Vosporos view”
Reviews.Author: elena074
Reviews.Content: Average breakfast (only the basics), friendly personnel , really good location very central, clean and cozy rooms and those with Vosporos view were amazing. Those on the street .. too noisy so be careful !

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: crazytravelernyc
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay - and second review - of this property. We stayed here again because of the location, which is terrific. Once again, we were disappointed with the front desk service - they push you to go to one restaurant - Olympos - which truly was horrible and expensive. I had asked in advance about rates, and the answer was cagey "it depends on which fish you order". They are clearly making commissions for bringing customers to that restaurant - don't go. The other disappointment was that we were not able to eat in the hotel restaurant, Lebi Derya. They were booked solid - so get that reso in advance if you want a nice evening in a spot with terrific views. This time we requested a room on a high floor away from Istikal Cadessi - and had a nice view and no noise at night to keep us awake. The rooms are small and lack personality, but have all the amenities you'd need for a business or leisure stay. BUT - I think I'd pass on this property next time and find some place with more personality, friendlier and more helpful service for a holiday stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location, really comfortable, staff taking care of you”
Reviews.Author: ghost_object
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 2 nights in June 2010. I found the staff very professional and helpful. There's someone to carry your luggage at your room when you arrive. I got a basic single room, I don't know the cost, but I guess it was for less than 100e/night. My room was very quiet, windows on the backyard. Everything worked well and the bed was very comfortable, shower and bathroom designed to be easy to use. Wifi connection was fast. Unfortunately I missed the breakfast every morning, there's just so much to do in Istanbul at night especially in such a great location (on the main walking street of the city's center). The staff at night took care of me, trying to give advice to be careful etc when going out at 3 am :) There was actually someone standing the whole night outside of the hotel to make sure everything was okay. The city center felt much more safer when you party than Barcelona for example and electronic music was great!! This hotel was a great choice, I'll return next time. I even got candy and flowers from the staff when leaving! It's just a pity that the hotel has maroon colors, could have a bit more young and fresh look in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but...”
Reviews.Author: Mick22
Reviews.Content: Great location, but noisy small rooms. I was at the back so no noise from the street, but could hear my neighbour sneeze and sing in the morning. Aircon was dodgy. Must be better to be had in Istanbul. On + side view from the 6th floor bar is fantastic, and staff friendly (bar the hostess at bar who dos not appear to enjoy her work!)

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, accommodating and very central.”
Reviews.Author: IammeLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in April with my new fiancee. We were upgraded to the Bosphorus Suite with complimentary wine and fruit when we mentioned we had just got engaged. The staff were efficient, helpful and discreet. The location of the hotel is very central yet quiet. It is the quietest hotel on that street and my fiancee chose it for this reason. The breakfast was delicious with lots of choice and the room was amazing. I found this hotel to be classy and focused on customer service. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “too small and depressingly boring rooms”
Reviews.Author: detoxify
Reviews.Content: We visited Istanbul during the New Year celebration of 2010. We stayed at Richmond hotel for four nights. The rooms at the front are too noisy (Istiklal). The rooms at the back were too small for two persons. I had to rearrange some furniture and hide our luggage somewhere so that we can have room to move! The closet had just enough room for our clothes. There was nowhere to hide our shoes. The interior of the room was depressingly boring. The bathroom products (showergel, shampoo, etc.) were of poor quality. Although we tried we didnot manage to gain access to internet from our room. The cleaning service was ok. The breakfast was ok. The bar at the top is wonderful, with great view and delightful surrounding. We passed the New Year's Eve there and we enjoyed it a lot. The location of the hotel is rather convenient although if you arrive by car you will have a hard time reaching it since Istiklal is a pedestrians' street. Of course the parking where you will leave your car is about 200 meters away with a fare price (10 euro/day), as long as you can find it. Overall, I strongly believe that we can do better next time... but if you don't have a choice (which is propably impropable in Istanbul!) you can stay here too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: skydiva
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect location for bars, restaurants, sightseeing. The hotel is really nice. There is a rooftop bar that is very chic. The rooms are really nice, mine was overlooking Istikal and if you're sensitive then get a room on the other side. I loved it. There were people milling about on the street all day and music, I found it invigorating. Breakfast was delicious and a good variety. There is wifi in the room. I don't remember there being a spa. We went to the hammam that was just a few blocks away... sorry don't remember the name but it was not cayoglu and it was not great. If you have experienced bathouses before then this is disappointing and not worth the price. If not then give it a try or go to Cayoglu (sorry if I'm misspelling). I fully recommend this hotel. It was very reasonable and an excellent hotel in a great location

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but no personality”
Reviews.Author: crazytravelernyc
Reviews.Content: If I were in Istanbul on business, I would stay here. The rooms are what you'd find at a city Hilton. The location was terrific for touristing and at night an easy area for finding restaurants. My husband and I stayed here and I agree - a bit noisy at night. The rooms are right over Istiklal Cadessi, and it's a main street where people walk, shop, go to restaurants. There was some police activity late one night, and a siren sounded waking my husband and me. The front desk was not helpful - couldn't recommend any other restaurants other than "360", were not very attentive when you were standing at the desk. Lebi Derya is the hotel restaurant - fantastic views and excellent fish dishes. Worth a visit whether you stay there or not. Breakfast was buffet-style with bread, fruits, cold cuts and yogurt. The coffee was from a Nescafe machine. Fine for a start to a day of touring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: Adda314
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Richmond hotel for three nights in July. I was on a business trip with my husband. Have to say the location is perfect! Right there on Istiklal street (3 milion people / weekend passing by) with shops and restaurants. It is close to the metro station also. We had a nice, big room on the second floor overlooking the street. The breakfast restaurant has an awesome view, is spacious and well lit and the food was a good selection. The room itself was ok, with a sofa and we had internet wireless which was a big plus for us. The downside - the noise from the street. Every once in a while we had to check if the windows were closed, it felt like they were not, that is how noisy it was especially in the evenings. The same with the connecting door we had. One morning we were awoken at 7am by the family with small kids next door. We came late in the room and we usually were too tired to be bothered by the noise but for someone who comes on vacation might be too much. The staff is ok. I would recommend it to everyone that goes to Istanbul and I would return there also. In the evenings look to the smaller streets from the main street. We found a nice, secluded, intimate terrace on top of a building. It wasn't the cleanest one but the waiter/owner was awesome and we had a great peach narghilea and tea there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Excellent service but they do not let you have a guest in your room even for a minute!”
Reviews.Author: WorldtravelerCyprus
Reviews.Content: I stayed three times in the hotel. It is clean. the first two times I was very excited with the rooms because of Bosporus view! It is extraordinary! the third time I was ok because i got a room that was looking in Taksim square and it was too noisy! I feel thought that it is a little bit expensive but still it worth the money. Ah! I forgot to say that I went with my friend on the room in order to take my suitcase and as soon as I got into the room they called me from the reception and they asked me to tell my friend to leave the room. I said no, so I had to pay the double room price!!!!! Thats why I didnt go again! Other than that they have the best restaurant on the roof with amazing Bosporus view!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: vmerkushev
Reviews.Content: We ordered the Bosphorus view deluxe room and were lucky to be upgraded to the suite room. So, you see I may be slightly biased but I liked this stay a lot. Great view of Bosphorus (and Russian consulate building), very good, clean, well-designed, spacious room. Breakfast was reasonable 4-star (instant coffee for breakfast was the only disappointment). The location is really excellent - every major sight is within walking distance. Well, and yes I suppose it is important to choose Bosphorus/consulate side because Istiklal street is a madhouse almost any hour of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Request the Right Room”
Reviews.Author: Pharo68
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I stayed in this hotel while in Turkey on business. I requested a non-smoking room and ended up on the 4 floor facing the street. One thing that makes this particular hotel nice is its location to one of the most popular streets in Instanbul. Needless to say the noise from the street was nuts. I requested to change rooms twice, on the third night of four, I was moved to a smoking room facing the interior courtyard. WHAT A DIFFERENCE! If you are considering staying here, ask for a room facing the courtyard, regardless of your smoking preference.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated”
Reviews.Author: ktee1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after having stayed in the Ceylan in previous years. We had an executive room which was spacious with tea and coffee making facilities and a large bathroom. The room was at the front of the hotel and there was a lot of noise on the Saturday night but the rest of the week was fine. The breakfast was more than adequate and the range far greater than in many turkish hotels with fruit, yogurt, tomatoes, cheese, yogurt, bread, eggs and hot food. Breakfast was available until 10 which meant that we had plenty of time to have a leisurely start to the day. the hotel itself is very well situated, we walked everywhere from it, and being close to the entrance to the tunel was great. We tried the bar one evening but found it very loud and expensive.

HotelInfo.Name: Richmond Hotel Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Istiklal Caddesi No 227 Tunel | Beyoglu, Istanbul 80670, Turkey
